meanings.definition: To put or place in a particular position or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: She set the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: Please set the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: He set the toy car on top of the fridge for fun.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the mountains, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The teacher set the rules clearly for the students to follow.

meanings.definition: A group of similar things that belong together or are used together.
meanings.sent1: The dish set includes plates, bowls, and cups.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new knife set for the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The Lego set was missing a crucial piece, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: The team was a set of talented individuals working towards a common goal.
meanings.sent5: The tool set in the garage had everything needed for repairs.

meanings.sent1: The table was set for dinner with plates and cutlery.
meanings.sent2: She was all set for the camping trip with a tent and supplies.
meanings.sent3: The cake was set to be decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: The stage was set for the grand performance with elaborate decorations.
meanings.sent5: The plan was set in motion for the big event.

meanings.sent1: He set the fence posts deep into the ground.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor set the statue in place at the park.
meanings.sent3: The glue set quickly, bonding the pieces together.
meanings.sent4: Her determination set her on the path to success.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree were set firmly in the soil.

meanings.sent1: She set the thermostat to a comfortable temperature.
meanings.sent2: He needed to set his schedule to accommodate the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The tailor set the dress to fit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The coach set the team strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: The artist set the colors to create a beautiful painting.
